reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed 6 nights in early June 2010 and had a beautifully quiet room overlooking the farms behind. The staff were most helpful with local maps and information. Bicylces are right there to rent for only 20,000/day and the woman immediately next door is just THE best motor scooter rider to hire. We paid US$25 a night (without haggling) and the only draw back for some might be that they only take cash - not Master Card or Visa. Fortunately the nearby ATMs worked well.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Relaxing 6 Days at Thien Nga

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here in a double room for $20 a night in October 2009 which seemed reasonable. I work as a volunteer in Hanoi, and got one of my Vietnamese colleagues to phone up and inquire about availability in April 2010. She was quoted $18 a night. When I phoned back 10 minutes later to book it I was told $30. When I passed her on to my colleague, she was told that there are special rooms for the Vietnamese with no internet access, and of course they wouldn't be using the pool! All nonsense of course, and an excuse for the dual-pricing system operating in Vietnamese hotels.I don't mind a bit being loaded onto prices for tourists, but almost double is ridiculous.
reviews.title: Simple, modern, with reasonable rooms, but dual- pricing system

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For $25 per room this place sucks. For a couple of dollars more you can get much, much better down the road at Thanh Xuan (Long Life). Reception staff were only interested in one thing - making as much money as quickly as possible out of travellers !
reviews.title: Overpriced, Damp room, terrible breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have just finished a 2 day stay here at the Thien Nga Hotel in Hoi An.
reviews.title: Hotel with all mod-cons, but prices seem to fluctuate person to person

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First impressions upon arriving here were quite impressive.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this property last minute bast on TA reviews and immediately was disappointed. Quoted $35 and agreed but upon arrival learned that the other guests were paying $25. Manager gave us the last room available, 2 beds(thus the higher price) on the street level and way noisy.... No shower curtain, icky floors, linens, blankets and generally a poor choice as Hoi An has dozens of great properties for $25-$40. Buffet bkfst choices were cold and old....A true backpackers dump! Guys were using the pool as a bathtub to rinse from a gritty day out... We found a great hotel(vinh Hung2) for $25 and were blown away with service and buffer bkfst. Manager was pushy with tours and trying to get us to stay and not check out. Only hotel that kept my passport and would not make a copy and return it timely.
reviews.title: Checked out as soon as I could!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room is definitely not worth 35 USD. There's no extractor fan in our room, which makes the room quite humid and muggy. And the selection of buffer breakfast is quite limit. Although the service is actually not bad in this hotel, for the same rates, you can find better rooms in either long life or vinh hung 3.
reviews.title: overcharged room, good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is located on a side street and backs up to rice fields therefore it is very quiet during the day and at night. The pool is lovely as is the patio area. The breakfast included fruit, banana pancakes, baguettes, jam, coffee. There are computers available for internet use. You won't be able to skype as the connection is too slow. Overall, the hotel is a very good value for the money and quiet comfortable.
reviews.title: Comfortable, quiet hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel is really good value for money. It's in a great location - walking distance to everything but the best thing about it is the staff. There is a lovely young lady at reception called "Fung" - she made our stay at this hotel one to remember. She made a concerted effort to remember all our names and we really enjoyed her lovely personality and warm greeting every time we came back to the hotel after a long day of "tailor hopping". Her and my teenage daughters got on famously and they were really sad to leave as they made a real friend.
reviews.title: Friendly hotel in one of the best places in Viet Nam!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff are incredibly honest - my 15 year old daughter (in our efforts to make a very early flight to Hanoi) left her Ipod Touch in the room. Not really thinking we would get it back, we called Fung who immediately did a quick check of the room. She came back to say that she couldn't find it but would have another look when it was a little quieter. True to her word, Fung went through the room and found the Ipod in the bedsheets (typical teenager!) and called my husband's mobile a number of times until we finally picked up. She then got the address of our Hotel in Hanoi and had the Ipod sent there the next day!! We were so amazed, and to top it off she called a couple of days later to make sure we had it! This girl will be getting a nice "Aussie" gift from us very soon :)
reviews.title: Stumbled upon a little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights ($30/room), room 201 with balcony looking over fields at the back. The actual bedroom was fresh and clean and great to sit on the balcony with a drink. Breakfast was good (buffet style) but they don't keep the eggs/pancakes in a warmer, so hover for the fresh ones to come out. 5 computers downstairs, slow but there. The hotel is just a short walk from old town area. We fould the hotel staff very friendly and helped up with calls to hotels in next towns. The down side of the stay was the poor state of the bathroom. Mold on the wall which looked to be a leak from the apartment above, there were spiders & webs in the bathroom that were not removed while we were there. Also the pillows were so large we couldn't use them, resorting to rolled up towels. Gripes are just with this one room though and so the others could be just fine. Still would look at staying again.
reviews.title: We liked it, but....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Room- on the plus side, there's a nice view and terrace. Similair room at Thien Than Hotel will take you back around 70$. On the down side, the toilet's shabby, so is the bed and there are no toiletries provided. MAKE SURE YOUR BED DOESNT ROLL AT NIGHT. THIS IS VERY UNCOMFORTABLE. When we complained about it on the second day (we used google translate to get the point across!), it seemes like a problem they were aware of
reviews.title: Very Average.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel- The wifi was not good. The breakfast was a joke. The worst we had so far. And the service well... didn't really strive for excellence.
reviews.title: shabby and over priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: this is a $15 hotel selling itself at $35. No shampoo, insufficient hot water to run a bath, No bath mat on slippery floor. Stained grubby lampshades. A cistern on the toilet which wobbled and threatened to crash to the floor. Wifi does not reach bedrooms and is switched off at 11pm when Europe wakes.
reviews.title: Not good value for money (room 35US a night)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a short stay at this hotel. If you compare the price I paid, 35US a night, to other places in HoiAn, then it's not a good deal. The room was fine: clean (great fluffy pillows !), balcony and cute lamps.
reviews.title: Not a good nights sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Rear rooms with balcony are the best. Honest people here.By mistake i left my money belt with plenty of cash on my bed.Was placed neatly on my bed when I got back.Nothing missing.Amazing.Don't know if it would have happened back home?
reviews.title: Will stay again without question

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean room, Small but adaquate breakfast.10 minute walk to Old town.Originally was at another hotel booked by an agency in Hanoi and it was rubbish.Way out of town and $10 more.I will stay here again without bothering to look around.
reviews.title: wonderful holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I use this sight to research hotels for our holiday and found original hotel in Hoi An sadly lacking then changed to the Thien Nga hotel as I remembered it from previous trip. A wonderful place to stay, staff are very nice and some quite funny, they are helpful. The hotel is very nice clean and has pool and air conditioning and located near middle of town. If you are looking for limo service etc it might not be for you but anyone else should love it, clean, well equipped, good breakfast and good price. I could not fault it and I think it is well above backpacker and just below 5 star.
reviews.title: Great value for money....without compromising on cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for four nights at the end of July beginning of August. We checked in here after spending one night at Long Life Hotel where the AC didn't work and there was no water pressure. We have been pleasantly surprised at this hotel, especially after the mixed reviews. The rooms are really clean, great value for money (we paid much less than at Long Life) and all the room amenities work, such as the AC, fan, internet, water pressure and bar fridge. We took a room with a view over the fields in the back and I think these rooms are quieter than the front rooms that have street noise. The staff have been really helpful and not pushy at all. I would stay here again and I think it's been great value for money.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, good room, good internet nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2 minutes from old town, great rooms/staff, cafe in the lobby and free wifi/internet computers. Great bang for your buck, nice swimming pool. Will organise transfers for you to/from airport/train. Cannot fault this hotel.
reviews.title: An enjoyable spot to stay while visiting the city if Hoi An.
